text: To be fair the service was good and the food just O.K. but just like everyone else mentioned the smell of the place was too much! It's smells like a dirty bathroom that was just sprayed with a very strong air freshener. Also, beware of coming after hours if you don't feel like being serenaded by very loud karaoke.
For the price it is good, compare to other Phos it is considered top of the chart. But need to improve on serving size for the rice with meat dishes. The dip sauce is excellent.
This place is awesome!  Food is always on point, atmosphere is classic, and the owner is super friendly. He is always there to greet you and make sure your well taken care of! Highly recommend!!!

First off all,  I am a pho restaurant junkie. On average I have it at least 2 to 3 times a week. Before, Pho Cao, opened up I had bounced around through a bunch of different places,  but now I have my regular spot!  
My pho of choice is normally the lean steak or chicken.  They are equally delightful. Lately though,  I have ventured out and tried the, shrimp pho with steak added, which I would highly recommend for a surf and turf style.  I have also tried the bun and fried rice.  Everything is great and reasonably priced! 
If you haven't already tried this place you need to.  The service is very hospital and the owner is a delight,  thanks Victor!

review for yelp- Pho Cao

dropping people off for a red eye flight to boston, i'd rather stay overnight in phoenix before driving home to tucson. so i went looking for an interesting restaurant. i found one in Pho Cao. just north of the university, in a bit of an odd building, well signed and easy to find. very nice inside, movable table/booth which is a big plus.

attractive decor, very nice service, our's was with matthew. each got something different. i had chicken curry, alma had chicken pho and jamie had noodles. we shared a fried sweet potatoes. presentation was really impressive, fresh mint, cut chili and key limes. big bowl of pho, lots of noodles, curry was excellent and perfectly spiced.

well recommended. nice place, glad we found it.

Have been here for lunch twice. The food is awesome and the price is right. The bar looks very well stocked, seems like it would be a pretty happening place for happy hour if the location wasn't so sketchy. Really looks like someplace you'd get stabbed from the outside but it's actually really nice on the inside. Worth the stop.

Prices are high for pho but if you eat during happy hour, with bogo 1/2 off app and $1 off pho bowls, it's a bit more reasonable.  Our waitress didn't give us the discount till we asked for it.

I had the Pho Cao special bowl P1.  Broth was okay but didn't taste like it had been simmering all day.  The noddles were slightly over cooked.  We also had the soft spring rolls and the spicy wings.  The wings were not crispy and cook just poured buffalo sauce over wings on plate creating a soup rather than tossing them playing.  Spring rolls were delicious.  
Service was fine.  Other than male wait staff placing our orders on edge of table then walking away without eye contact, and female server not providing discount before being asked, Service was prompt and courteous.  I would come back when in mood for pho.
No a bad place to eat.  Came in after a long day of car shopping and the service was good and food was fast  and priced right  so I will def be back

This is my go to spot for vietnamese food! Not only do they have what I would consider to be the best pho in the Phx area, but they have an incredibly friendly staff & excellent customer service(our servers name was Daniel, who was willing to answer all our questions on the menu)
I have tried both the traditional pho (#13) and the pho with rare stake & meatballs, and both are delicious. 
If you aren't in the mood for hot soup, they have a full menu with my personal favorite being the chicken curry. Like nothing I've ever tasted before. 
A fun atmosphere with good people. Victor & Holly are great people, with a wonderful local business! They even have fun events such as blues night & karaoke. 
Will continue to be a pho cao regular!
I love the food. Their pho and Thai tea were yummy. I came back many times. Sometimes it is very loud, so expect to deal with that.
Will not be returning due to flavorless food. We used the sauces on the table and still tasted bland. The noodles seemed reheated and stale. Not an enjoyable experience.

NOTE: I came here for the pho, not the happy hour beer or bar food.

This is quite possibly the worst pho I've had in a long time. It was bland and the hoisen and siracha did not help. I ordered a salty plum drink and it came 30-45 min later, after asking about it 3 times so obviously I was a little pissed at the service. Also, I've never had a red berry flavored salty plum drink. The server was not knowledgeable about the menu at all and even forgot the side of rice my friend ordered, but was still charged for it. To top things off, the pho was expensive. 

I'd say the best part of the meal was the spicy chicken wings, which was the first thing we got and went down hill from there.

So we ordered chicken wings, summer rolls, 2 bowls of pho, 2 drinks and stir fry noodles with a side of rice = $60 including the automatic 18% gratuity from  the Living Social coupon. There a ton of other pho places in Phx where the same amount of food would cost $30-40. If you just wanna go for happy hour and/or some late night pho, be my guest!
Bate and switch from their menu online to the menu in the restaurant.  Pho was alright, server was nice but the place is a horrible dive.  Owner is a douche
The pho was amazing and the pork spring rolls are out of this world (so is the peanut sauce for them!). The pho broth was light and silky yet exploding with flavor. Excellent place for lunch.

I stopped by last night for the first Bluesday night jam and I had a blast. The atmosphere was great and the blues jam was amazing. I cannot speak for the food as I just stopped by on my way home to hear the blues, however, the staff was friendly and attentive.  I will be back next Tuesday for food and the jam!
Pho is a terrific place,  great place to party and food is very good and fresh, plus great staff.  It's a perfect blend of tempe and scottsdale crowd. Very Good!
Not only great food but our server Edwin was funny and showed us a great time! I definitely am coming back with the guys again!
Food was tasty (a bit too oily, but ok), service was good, prices were fair, but overall nothing memorable. Not a 5-star place...and a few of the 5 star reviews seem like they are planted.

Came here at 11pm on a Friday night after work for some pho, and was greeted at the door with $5 cover charge??!!! Can't really review on the food because I sure wasn't going to pay $5 just to be able to sit down to eat and then pay another $7 for the actual meal.
Awesome pho ! But music was just a little bit too loud, was hard to have a conversation with my boyfriend,
This is the best Pho in Scottsdale hands down!  I love the spicy tamarind option as no one makes their broth spicy enough.  We are repeat customers and will continue to do so.

It's ok. New place still trying to figure it out. First time we came here I ordered the fried rice. It was horrible. Came out cold and greasy. Second time I ordered the Steak Pho. It just left this weird taste in my mouth but was good. Music was way too loud though. It seems popular though on certain nights. Parking lot is packed. I'll probably come back but not sure about it yet.

The people here are wonderful & helpful! It's a great location for me to get something really good at decent prices & they were quick(only 10mins). I really don't know Vietnamese food well, but the large Pho Chin did me well. WAY bigger than expected, all the fixin's separated (I ordered to-go) and that way I made it all to taste. I'd much rather do that than be surprised by too much or too little of something. The potstickers are huge & delicious. I can't wait until the next time. I'm gonna eat in & have a few drinks & sample an entree next! YAY! 
(btw-not all good things are "planted". I just think this place is great &I'm glad it's finally a business that's in that location & doing well)     ;)

Yes, the place is a little odd, and from reading the reviews I can see where the place has a little bit of an identity crisis, but I thoroughly enjoyed my experience. Let me be clear though - I went to see a band, not for the pho, so take that into consideration as you read this review. 

I got there about 30 minutes before the first band, and even though I went in through the wrong entrance (I went in through the door the bands load and unload) I got greeted and seated immediately. Service throughout the evening was just fine. I never had to wait around for anyone to show up with another drink, the guy was always around. Food was good. I've had better Vietnamese food in the valley, but have no complaints about the food served here.

I can understand someone coming specifically for Vietnamese fare and being put off by the divey sports-bar vibe at lunch time, or rolling in later at night to find a loud band up on stage, or drunk karaoke fans howling away. But for me, looking at it as a venue for live music, I think it was great. The place has a nice setup for live music and the bands sounded good. I got to sit at a table, get well taken care of by my waiter, eat decent pho, have some beers, and watch some great bands playing original music. 

I'm definitely going back.

"Don't judge a book by its cover!" This place was actually pretty good. We weren't too sure how it would be just because the place looked practically empty. But the pho was awesome! I will definitely be coming back!

Nothing is good here.  Came in for lunch and was very disappointed.  No napkins on the table, no plates with our appetizer.  Paid for food we hardly touched. The flavor was off and the spring rolls were stuffed with iceberg lettuce.  The location is great but good Veitnamese food can be found elsewhere and will be worth the drive.

My boyfriend and I went here for lunch with an Entertainment Book mobile coupon. This was my first Vietnamese food.

The  Com Chien Dac Biet (Cao's Special Fried Rice) was lightly seasoned and good. (Although my boyfriend thought it was a bit skimpy on the meat.) He had a vegetarian dish which was quite yummy.

I would give this place 4 stars, except they gave us a hassle regarding the coupon. After speaking with "the owner's wife", the server stated flatly that the coupon was only good on Pho. He continued this stance, even after I politely pointed out the coupon explicitly stated, "Buy ANY menu item and get one menu item free, up to $7 off." I politely asked twice to speak to the manager. My boyfriend pointed out to the manager the BOGO was good on any menu item with a max value of $7. She called her husband. Finally, they accepted the coupon.

We never would have known about the restaurant without the deal. We were their only customers on a Saturday afternoon, (so maybe they should be nice to customers). We use the book regularly, and never get hassled. Also, the "manager" should be allowed to make a $7 decision.

It was good enough food and fair prices; so we will probably go back.

Went to this place for the first time last night. The food was freaking OUTSTANDING.

Came here to write a review and was completely baffled by some of the other extremely poor reviews...

I will say that I know that this restaurant just recently moved from another location, and I have to wonder if the chaos that that sort of event can create in a business was responsible for some of the other reviewers' poor experiences?

The decor is a bit strange, I will give it that. It's a bit pool hall, a bit dive bar, a bit karaoke bar... Not really a place that, just LOOKING at it, you would think would have great food.

I went in with a friend (fellow foodie) who'd been and was a fan. We grabbed seats at the bar and were immediately served by Victor, the owner.

Victor is funny and personable, and clearly has a quirky personality. After meeting and speaking with him, I think the atmosphere is really just a reflection of who he is. He is quick to laugh, loves karaoke, and is passionate about creating quality food (we had a 5 minute discussion about his selection of high-quality rice, preparation methods for it, etc.).

MY experience was probably the tastiest Vietnamese food I have ever had. I will definitely be a repeat customer and can't wait to try more of the menu.

Last night I had the Spicy Spring Rolls (BBQ pork, rice paper wrapper, Sriracha & Peanut sauce), Tom Chien Gion (Fire-Cracker Shrimp - coconut-crusted, deep fried shrimp with sweet & sour sauce), and Com Bo Luc Lac (Shaken Beef). Everything was perfection. And the beef was juicy, tender and flavorful.

Service was impeccable...

If you love good food, and a venue with a personality, do NOT skip this place due to a few bad reviews. If you're worried, find Victor. He will be sure to take care of you.
My favorite pho sho. Awesome atmosphere, cheap drinks, all my favorite local bands... Just a great place.

This place has a weird stinky smell. I'm vietnamese n know about real viet food, this place don't even have the nice soup smell that other restaurant have. They are lucky if people go to there restaurant and give them business. Business was slow there, that could be why they charge a fee if one doesn't order $10 or more... I have never heard of places charging a fee cuz the bill's total was not over $10 and this was cash transaction. so instead i cancel my order because there a much taster pho restaurant nearby that doesn't charge a fee.

#1: The managements crying child literally dripping snot on the floor, uncared for. #2: A server who could not remember our 2 item order. Asked again what our order was and still got it wrong. #3: Vegetarian egg rolls came filled with PORK. The management came out and picked up our food with bare hands, then left without a word. Hid in the kitchen. We left as soon as possible.....NEVER to return!

Eh. Average pho grub. Hipster-ish waiter/aura. Pretty empty on a Saturday night.
The service was not bad, just slow and lack luster. The waiter was nice but not very attentive since he was also setting up for karaoke. They were out of Thai tea and took long enough for me to contemplate going I  the back and making it myself.


When we initially walked in no one acknowledge us. We asked the the bartender if we should seat our selves and she said "Oh, yeah." 

Guess that's what I mean by hipster vibe, not just the fashion but the blasé attitude.
Nothing to come back for.

I'd only go back to this place if I were in the neighborhood and it was the nearest Pho location. It's not quite the Pho I crave.
The Pho was tasty but the portion was small. The combination didn't have all the combination meats that I expected it to have. 
I also had a taste of the Vermicelli noodles with pork. It was a small bowl jam packed with vegetables. Very very small handful of meat. You can get more meat in your vermicelli noodles elsewhere. The fish sauce was really sweet even when I added chili sauce it didn't quite taste right. And the bowl came with one roll of eggroll. Most other places give two rolls.
This place is amazing! Super delicious and fantastic price for the amount of food you get! We recommend this to everyone!

I'm Vietnamese so I've had a lot of experience with Vietnamese food. Been to pho Cao 2 times. The service here is very bad. Bot times I went with a couple buddies and there were maybe 10 ppl in the whole restaurant. It took about 30 mins to get our app, which was the nem cuon..it was so so nothing special, the one at com tam thuan kieu at Mekong plaza is probably the best in town. Then we ordered our pho, it was bland! I can smell the anise (way too much of it) but that's about it. I couldn't even taste the beef of the broth. I tried to fix it by adding more hoisin than I normally add and siracha, but no luck.  I then had to ask for fish sauce to give it some flavor. Now its more edible. It's pretty bad if I have to add fish sauce to my pho. Oh, I also had to ask for napkins, the waiter brought our food but no napkins....twice! One time for the app and then for the pho. I've also had the shaken beef there the first time visiting and the flavor is good, only complain with that is they cut the beef too small. Shaken beef should be about 1 inch cubes bite sized, so u get a beefier bite each time. And lastly, they have karaoke! That's great! But it's a Vietnamese restaurant, yet they don't have any Vietnamese karaoke. Only English karaoke. I find that very ironic.

I can't tell you how the food is because I didn't even get that far. The waiter came over with our menus and place mats. He dropped a place mat on the floor, stepped on it, then picked it up and put it on the table in front of my fiance. I asked him to please get us a new one and clean the table off for us and he gave an aloof apology. He came back with fresh place mats, which he tucked under his armpit as he wiped our table with a rag, using no cleaning solution (and who knows where the rag had been). He put our now-wrinkled place mats down in front of us and asked what we wanted to drink. We left about 2 minutes later never to return.

One star is giving them WAY too much credit. DO NOT GO HERE!!! There are so many other great pho restaurants in Tempe and Scottsdale to have to settle for the terrible service at Pho Cao. They are not worth your precious, hard earned money!!! I ordered a bowl of pho, and after my first bite my throat and lips began to burn and go numb. I took another bite to make sure I wasn't going crazy and sure enough I was having an allergic reaction to the soup. I asked our waitress if they poured a ton of chili oil or something in the soup to make me have this allergic reaction and she said that their was no spice added. I asked her if I could have something else since I obviously was not going to be able to eat something that was making my throat and lips go numb. She "checked" with her manager and they said that they would not replace it since it's my fault for ordering it. Her manager told her that a jalapeño seed was causing my reaction even though the jalapeño was clearly on plate and not in my soup - nor did any jalapeño seeds get even remotely close to my soup. I showed her that the jalapeño and seeds were not in my soup and she said, "sorry there's nothing we can do." I have never been to a restaurant with such poor service in my entire life. I am so disappointed that I had to waste my hard earned money and time at this terrible restaurant. 

SERVICE MATTERS! PLEASE GO ELSEWHERE!!!

So happy to have a Pho place open late and nearby!  Beautiful, relaxing interior -- which is pretty unique among Vietnamese restaurants.  The vegetable pho really does come with lots of veggies; not just basil and bean sprouts.  There are a number of non-pho items on the menu that I look forward to trying.  Quick and friendly service, and some decent beers on tap.  Although it would be great to see a tap for Hop Knot or Stone added.  And very decently priced.  Thanks for opening!

I stopped by for lunch for job I worked nearby. 

First of all, the service was impeccable---I was in a bit of a time crunch, so I informed the hostess and both she and my waiter were prompt and made sure I was done by the time requested. Additionally, I asked for Boba and, despite it not being on the menu, the kitchen prepared a cup. They didn't have the wide straws, but I was nevertheless impressed by their willingness to accommodate me. 

The Pho itself is the reason I chose not to give five stars. It's flavor was above average: The broth was rich and robust. The noodles appear to have sat dry for a few minutes too many, as they were clumped together. I attribute it to the lack of a much rush, so it isn't a fatal flaw. 

All in all, Pho Cao exceeded expectations for a nightclub-esque noodle shop. I'll be back for more Pho and the puns that came with it.

The pho was phabulous!!  We had a great meal at this new and wonderful restaurant... Go check it out and I know you will love the food and the owner, Victor, who really made sure we had a great experience.
GREAT PHO!!!! friendly staff easy parking

What a disappointment.

The owner has really lost touch with his community.  

So many good folks have reached out. After many attempts, this place is completely  unresponsive to everyone and everything.  

Our community in scottsdale would normally help a business like this thrive.   With kind and supportive assistance from the locals, Pho Cao could be a happening business full of arts, entertainment, and many happy folks returning for more and more fun.  

They refuse to have an open mind or open heart for parties, local gatherings, and community functions. 

Pho Cao.  You need to remember. 1 person is not the community.  The community however, speaks, via select people.  

Shame on you.

I have been here twice, so far, and each time was impressed.  The first time, I was craving noodles, and got there after hours when the kitchen had closed and they had only Pho left on the menu.  The owner went back and cooked me noodles anyway, which were spectacular.  The next time I went, I tried some Pho with Sriracha sauce in it.  Absolutely delicious.  Was not hip to nor expecting the music they apparently have there, but will return anytime for the food and would recommend it to anyone who asks.

I have gone here a couple of times for lunch, and I tried this place for a late dinner on a Saturday night. I think the experience is a 3 but the food is a 4. 

The good: the pho and the goi cuon (spring and "summer" rolls) are pretty legit. Despite the higher prices (what do you expect in Scottsdale), the flavor is on point. The service is fast and I like that there is an option to have beer with my Vietnamese food (because Heineken makes the experience, people).

The meh: Weekend nights are strange here. We showed up at around 8 or so. There were 3-4 different cover bands singing karaoke-grade covers, and all 55+ as far as age. That's not a bad thing, it just wasn't the scene I was hoping for. It was, however, really obvious they need a sound guy. The feedback on the speakers was miserable and ongoing. Not pleasant for a dining experience. 

I would like to go back again (and this is 100x better than Noodles Ranch up the street) but I'll try again on karaoke night to see how the vibe is.
My go to Pho' house.Been going here for about 2 years.Best Pho I've tried in Phoenix,great service.

Place is just a dive surprisingly how good it looks on the outside. Pretty dark and grungy indoors. Food is just ok, could have more flavor. Curry seemed like it was watered down. Service is mediocre. There is definitely better Pho around Scottsdale to go after.

Not authentic Vietnamese food.  The taste and the food is more for American people.  And they are pricey too.  Pho didn't tastes very exciting but the fish sauce chicken wings were good.  They were a little spicy but we could handle it.
Awesome food, great atmosphere and unbelievable happy hour prices. They also serve fresh boba tea. I just found my new favorite hang out.

Good...for Arizona. Moving from NYC I was looking for a great pho/bahn mi place. This is the best for the area, but let's be honest, that ain't saying much. Weird place, weird vibe, but certainly decent enough food to satisfy any cravings for vietnamese cuisine you may have.
Great pho and live music Friday and Saturday. Definitely coming back!

Nice place with decent Asian food. Pho Cao is mainly a bar that also serves food. Good staff that seems to care about their patrons.

Wish they'd cut back on the garlic and use better quality chicken parts (i.e. Only use chicken breasts).

The food is amazing.  I had the pho and my friend had a plate of rice noodles with beef and veggies.  Both dishes were great.  And they use fresh ingredients which is what I loved most about it.  As good as the food was the happy hour drink prices were even better.  This is definitely my new fav restaurant bar.

I would have given them a 2 stars but the waiter was kind and I came to this place once before when I Was out of town in January and it was delicious. This time I came and the vermicelli I ordered the lettuce and bean sprouts were wilted and brown. I still eat, because service took forever and I Was starving from traveling. But I kindly notified the waiter to notify the chef. I do not know if I come back again if I'm in Scottsdale...

This place has the best fried rice, egg rolls, pot stickers.  I'm half Filipino and have had my share of these types of dishes.  I tried the Pho for the first time here and found it very tasty, however I was not told about the different sauces you can add, and kinda went over board. I plan to try some of the variety of Pho they have to offer.  

Be sure to stick around every Wednesday, Thursday and most Friday's for the Karaoke, the song list is the best, the hosts are a lot of fun, and they even play some of the most current songs in between singers.

The staff, makes it a fun place to eat, drink and be entertained, thanks Matt, Nick, Jason, Ben, Linda, Terry, all the kitchen personnel and of course Victor the owner.

I moved so I haven't been there recently. I heard they recently moved too. I'm planning a trip out there soon because I miss their pho thai bowls, Bánh mì sandwiches, and thai teas. Can't wait!

UPDATE: I went there on Friday 5/5/17 and had a very disappointing and negative experience. My roomate and I were in the area. So, we stopped by for an early dinner around 5pm. The place was completely empty. We walk in and sit ourselves in a booth. After a few minutes, a waitress comes out and comes by to our table to take our orders. We both order two Thai iced teas and some appetizers: fried calamari, and an order or spring rolls, which we shared. The calamari were very different than I'm used to at any other restaurant. But, not bad. The disappointing and strange part is that they were served with a side of shrimp cocktail sauce  (unoriginal). We were both starving at that point, so we both scarfed down the appetizers and waited for our dinner entrees. I ordered a bowl of Pho soup (regular size #6) and my roomate ordered a chicken curry dish.  I guess I should have paid attention that my pho was not steaming hot as it normally is served. But, like I said before, we were starving. Right after our dinner we both started to feel overly full. Which is somewhat normal after eating a bowl of pho. But the strange part is that after we got home, I noticed that my stomach felt upset even 4 hrs after. I took some Pepto to soothe my stomach upset. A little while later, I would spend the rest of the night and part of the next morning vomiting the entire contents of my stomach. Which was everything I had for dinner. I had a bad case of food poisoning!  I had not felt that sick and horrible after eating anywhere in years. As far as I can recall, I had only had food poisoning once before. And the symptoms were pretty similar. Either the cook or the kitchen is operating under unhealthy sanitary conditions, or the soup was not cooked to proper temperature to prevent someone from getting sick.  Either way,  I can no longer recommend this restaurant to anyone. Sad. Because I had been there several times before without incident. 

BEWARE: If you have the pho soup here, make sure it's piping hot! And still, eat at your own risk. Sorry Victor. Maybe it is just the cook. Either way, heads up on checking that the kitchen is operating to proper food handling/preparation standards. I'm sorry I had to give you a bad review.  I just don't want anyone else getting as sick as I did.

Very good Vietnamese restaurant with a good Pho selection menu. Prices are very reasonable and if you like them on FB, You'll learn the $5 specials they post every so often. 
Only thing I would suggest is that they make the Spring rolls (Goi cuon) just a tad bigger. But, they usually do their best to get you substitutions (if requested nicely).

I don't have tolerance for suffering through the torture of listening to people who sound like sheep being slaughtered, so I avoid "karaoke time". But if you do, knock yourself out! ;-)

Fyi, Victor is the owner and manager here. He is friendly, helpful, and VERY serious about his business. He is always trying to make sure service is good. 
I get the feeling some of these other "posters" just wanted to bad mouth this restaurant to be petty, more than anything. SMH

So there *I* was...

Trying to get lunch with a couple of friends, a lunch that would never happen. We drove up to find a rugged looking parking lot with signs barring customers from drinking liquor in the parking lot and jäger bottles in the windows, that should've been the first red flag. But we got out the car and saw a woman who said she was the health inspector who was here to inspect the place. We laughed and made jokes but still walked in. 

We were greeted by a waiter who seemed to be the only person working and there was only one other table filled in the entire place. We ordered a sandwich, pho, lemongrass chicken & spring rolls. We were never asked for our drink order... Kinda odd move for a bar that happens to serve food. We were nibbling on our spring rolls as we saw the health inspector announce herself and head into the kitchen. Nearly a half hour later we were only served my sandwich and the rest was still coming. We waited some more time and wanted to pay for the sandwich and leave; when the owner came and bagged my sandwich and handed it to me. 

We were bewildered and after asking some questions, it turned out their health inspection didn't go so well and they were getting shut down. The inspector didn't even let them make our lunch! I can't say how the sandwich because I didn't exactly feel like eating it. My friend who ate the lion-share of the shrimp spring rolls said they were okay except the lettuce and cabbage was old and browning and the shrimp tasted of cardboard. I'm writing this at the end of the day and happily, I can report that none of us experienced any tummy troubles from the compromised food. 

To my Yelpers I say: I can't even tell you to skip this place because they got shut the hell DOWN!!

The worst service I have ever had when I went to this place today. Previously had great experiences today was hell. Blake was my waiter and I pray for the customers he has after me today. Asked for hot tea. Brought tea mug and brought it over so carelessly there was hot water all over the plate. It dumped down my leg. After that the refill was the same way. Asked about spring rolls said I don't eat pork. He recommended the first one with pork. Then repeated I don't eat pork recommended the only other one on there with pork in it so settled on the spider ones and made my own non pork decision. Brought out 2 entrees to the customers I was with. Mine never came out. Double checked what was going on assured it was on the way. My pho never came. Walked over to kitchen after long wait and asked him to box it to go with noodles separate and all components separate . Noodles in my broth and all the meat. Asked and paid for extra meat, got 2 extra prices of shrimp no extra meat. Majority of ingredients not on side so noodles Super soggy and gross by the time I got home to eat. Icing on the cake the bill was $68.50 I gave him $100 he brought me back 30$ while explaining and I quote " I couldn't find another 1.50$ so here is 30 back sorry about that. I left no tip and will not return. Worst waiter and service ever. Worst to go ever.
Love this place. The staff is great, food is amazing, and the price is reasonable. Win win win

We went to see why it was always packed in the parking lot, and come to find out its because the food is great and the service was amazing. We went and heard live music with our kids, they really enjoyed it. Our server was so attentive. A gentleman from the band approached our children and gave them stuffed animals. The manager opened the door and welcomed us back on our way out. We just had an overall great experience and will defientely recommend this place and come back for more. 
Although I couldn't pronounce the dishes, the description was well said that it helped me decide. All of our food and apps were amazing. Most certain I would like to try more of what is on the menu. Thank you for our wonderful night!

Tasty pho that is complex in flavor. Other great options are the wings, curry and summer rolls. Service is consistent and attentive. Locale features rotation of strong local acts like Sugar Thieves, The Effects and many others, plus radio broadcast highlighting bands. Highly recommend this place. Make it a point to put this place on your radar.

What a disaster.  I go in with my girlfriend, we sit, the place is almost empty. I use the men's room, it smells like the sewer line is open.  Come back, we order a beer and a white wine.  Waitress comes back with a room temperature glass of wine, I get a bottle, no glass to pour it in.  Waitress disappears, I go up to bar to get a glass, and the guy at the bar does a 90 degree turn away from me.  Eventually he comes back, I ask for a glass, and my dining partner asks for white wine that isn't warm.  OK, food time.  We both order Pho Ga', chicken pho.  My chicken is half cooked, and the pieces are all ligaments and muscle.  Waitress gives us our food, says she will be right back with napkins, but never comes.  After several minutes she comes by to ask how we are doing, I say "uh, napkins", and she runs to get them, drops them off on the table and blithely says "no problem!".  Well, there is a problem, when she comes back again, I show her undercooked chicken with all kinds of gristle and un-chewable bits on it.  She apologizes and offers to get me something else...well, if you can't cook chicken, then I don't want anything else.  I ask for the check and get another snotty "no problem!" response.  Well, there is a problem, bad food, bad service, dangerously under cooked chicken and a bathroom that smells like death.  No, I'm not going back, there are plenty of quality Pho restaurants out there that offer quality food and good service.  This place is a disaster.

Edited to add 5/26/16:  After posting this review, the manager, David Gump sent me a profanity laced email (he used the F word 4 times) and accused me of being cheap and trying to get a free meal...I NEVER asked for anything to be comped.  He also said that I was banned for life and that "We have wars because of people like you.  You need to get back to school and get educated."  I'd post more of his email, but I do not wish to share the profanities that he sent to me.  His email to me really confirms that this is not a place I ever want to do business with again.  Please avoid this place and this unprofessional manager.

It seems like this place is trying to make it work, but it's barely working...

I got the surf and turf Pho and I got 2 pieces of beef and 2 pieces of shrimp for 9$, I'm not impressed. His was the house rice and it looked like a pile of mush! 
Staff was attentive and friendly...

Don't over charge the customer so you can afford a space as big as a warehouse!

Look. The Pho is pretty good, but the service is awful. It's 1:08 and I still haven't received the coffee I ordered at 12:12. The place has one other guest so busy really doesn't qualify as an excuse for your delay. Our checks took over 20 minutes to get, one guy had to ask 3 times for his beer. On top of that, they put 12 customers on our receipt so that our group of 6 was charged gratuity (probably good because our waitress did not deserve a tip). I'm extra pissed because your staff failed to clean up the stickiness on and under my seat, and my shoes now are permanently sticky. Don't know that we will be back.

I was beyond impressed with my first experience here. So much that I would even say this is my new favorite spot in Tempe! The service was impeccable. The atmosphere was comfortable, with nice decor. Best part, the food! I ordered the Mongolian beef and it was perfect. I was with 3 other people that had also never been there before and everyone agreed that it was great! I cannot wait until my next visit so I can try the sushi.

Very good food. Environment is not your typical pho joint. It's a bar that does live music, and has covers charged on occasion. Which I personally find annoying. My meal is $10 and the cover just to sit is $5? No thank you. I suggest getting your order to go. Calling ahead is fast and they are very good about getting your food out to you once you get there. Servers and service is good and very friendly. I will be back for the pho but not the live music.
Great twist to a Pho setting! Loved it. Friendly, down to earth staff. Great food. Prompt service. Plenty of TV's if you're trying to catch a game. Music, on point!

This is the first Pho restaurant that I've been to in phoenix - my boyfriend and I have gone here twice now- the food is good and it's reasonably priced. I get #13 and he always gets #1. He's never had Pho before and he loves this place! I think it's pretty good.  It's never crowded or super packed - there's always a place to sit and they have a huge bar and a bunch of TVs on the walls which is different for a Vietnamese style restaurant haha...a few people have commented on the smell of the restaurant and they must've done something about it because I've never noticed a weird smell. Overall I give this place a four stars - it's not the most amazing Pho I have had but I will probably go there again.
They do a great job at this place I go there at least once or twice a week.  Soup is good and they have coconut here.  I don't have to drive to north Phoenix for good pho.

Yum. We've been here twice now and absolutely love the food.  We tried another place down the street and it was SO bland and boring - Pho Cao's food is all extremely flavorful.  Serving sizes are generous, prices are decent, and the food is amazing.  Surf and turf pho is our favorite! I did dock a star because it's very dive-y.  They have fairly loud local acts and open mic nights and it's very dark in there for dinner.  If you can deal with that, though (which I recommend), the food is spectacular and service is above average.

So, I was actually a virgin to Pho until I tried it here for the first time. Now I can't get enough. It's delicious, filling as well as healthy.  I was told by a worker there that they cook the broth for 24 hours. I tried the beef and the chicken, both were equally tasty. The portion is large. One soup makes two full meals for me. Very fair prices too.  

The staff was very welcoming and friendly when I went, which is the main reason why I keep going back.  The restaurant does look like a dive bar for sure which I was not expecting when I walked in, but its still a nice local place to eat.  

Tip- they have karaoke if your into that

Bland Bland Bland the food was awful and the server never asked how everything was because she already knows the answer it is awful. Do not waste your money! Talk about a surprise when you walk in to a nightclub like bar.

The food here is really good. I feel like the environment could use a bit of a renovation but the main attraction is the bowls of Pho and they are phenomenal. 

One night there were all screaming/ metal band with enough wattage to power an EDC concert it was deafening lol).

I wont ding them too hard because I am sure it was not done on purpose or maybe I didn't realize it was a metal concert that night.

We love the Bun  Bo Hue, or spicy beef noodle soup. If you like pho, you have to try this. Thicker noodles, darker spicier broth, and it has a mixture of meets.

The fried egg rolls are bomb! But most Vietnamese egg rolls are bomb, so what can I say.

They have a Bo Luc Lac dish, or shaken beef thats pretty good. I would rate it a 3 of 5 because Ive had better. Its a little too sweet for my palate.

The food was absolutely amazing , had a really good dinner before catching a movie on a Saturday night. 
The waiter was great and attentive on refilling our waters , plus the food came fast , which was great because I was starving! They play good relaxing music with good ambulance .... Highly recommend coming here! Will deff be coming back soon :)
Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Only had a taste of a few items as I am a vegan but the non-vegans in our group really liked their food.

Husband and I went here for the first time tonight......  we are new to this area of Scottsdale and always like to try out the nearby businesses wherever we live... especially love to support family run businesses opposed to big franchise whenever we can. We don't know a lot about Vietnamese cuisine but have eaten it before at a couple other places over the years, including a food truck operation that offered up pho and other vietnamese foods; my husband had the pho with chicken and they bring you the broth and the add ins separately so you can add what you want ....since they do include Jalapeños, nice to be able to add what you prefer to spice it to your liking; I had the pineapple rice with chicken and shrimp which was served in a half of a pineapple, was wonderful and attractively presented.  Portions are very ample, hubby did devour every drop of his soup and I brought enough leftovers home for both of us tomorrow  :) While eating we enjoyed some awesome blues.... I understand this band is there regularly..... great service, the staff was wonderful, it's a fun place to people watch and we look forward to coming back often....

Extremely disappointed, tonight is the last night time I will ever give this place money. We placed an order through Postmates for crispy rolls, 2 chicken phos and a side of rice, got charged around $33 for everything. We received our food and noticed they forgot 1 of the phos. Mind you this happens constantly at Pho Cao and we're always having to drive back for something they forgot. Anyway, we called to tell them they forgot 1 pho and like any business with good customer service they would acknowledge their mistake and try to fix the situation, that was the complete opposite here. The OWNER started getting very angry and arguing on the phone about how it's Postmates fault and we need to call them when clearly it wasn't, we then said we had no problem driving over to get the 1 pho they forgot and he just continued to argue with us and be rude. After about 10 minutes of the OWNER being extremely unprofessional and extremely rude we told him we will not be going to his establishment any longer and hung up. There are plenty of good places that serve great pho that don't have owners who are crooks.

Yay !!! Finally found a pho place that actually open till 2am!! And so I thought........this place is baaaaaddddd  !!! I order pho with steak, tripe, tendon... The broth taste terrible .. it literally taste like they open a can of chicken broth cook it and add white noodles to it!! Shoot I can make better pho than this ... And I don't know how lol  my friend order ramen noodle(something like that) he said "ramen noodle make better ramen than that" hahaha  guess he's not a fan too. On a positive note They do have live band ... On the look for another pho place

First impression....I keep expecting to look up and see John Taffer charging in with the camera crew to shoot an episode of "Bar Rescue".... Oh my god.  Came here with the idea of having Vietnamese food, but I think I made a huge mistake! Its dark, dingy, and there's a speaker directly above the table blaring reggae at me (the server said she'd turn it down, but hasn't happened yet...).  Mkay.  My first reaction is to run for the door. (I should have!)
We split an order of spring rolls as an appetizer, well more of a side dish since it came out with everything else.  Very disappointing at $6-- mostly brown lettuce inside.  I could only choke down half of one, and no one was interested in the other half.  Oh, I seriously should have gone!
I ordered the combo fried rice ($12) because it was the most reasonably priced entree and I felt it wouldn't make me sick.  The rest of the menu was too outrageously over priced for me to consider ($15 for stir fried beef w/onions and bell peppers? $13 for sort of pork chop and rice? Really?!). Again, I should have just said no.  It was ok, but I was not about to touch those three partially deveined, partially shelled, rubbery shrimp! Ew! The tv dinner pea/carrot mix is kind of expected (but usually at a much lower price point!). The quantity was sufficient, but that may have had more to do with my loss of appetite than anything else.  
Top it off with $2.75 for a glass of diet coke, and you can call me less than thrilled about my experience here today.
I've said before, I don't mind paying a little more for quality.  When I'm charged quality prices and you don't deliver, I get pissed.  This was $35 for a pretty bad lunch.  I work hard for my money and I don't like wasting it.
So unless you're going in as the mole for "Bar Rescue"-- take my advice and run.  Run for the door and get in your car! Don't look back! Just go.
Good food. Great atmosphere. And the pho is great. Fast service and not over priced. I'd recommend this place to anyone

If I had to describe this oriental eatery in one word, it would be atrocious. The service, the cuisine, and the atmosphere made me wish I had no taste buds, ears, or senses of any kind. I came with 3 tantalizing young women, who were promptly cat called by a cretin on the way in. Granted, they were all drop dead gorgeous, but they were not impressed. Upon entering this pathetic excuse for an establishment, we were distraught to see that 2 heathens were playing guitar and singing folk tunes on the restaurant's incredibly loud speakers. Imagine the worst voice you've ever heard in your life. Then imagine a worse voice than that one. We were subjected to the previously mentioned voice crooning horrific show tunes for well over half an hour. We had nowhere to run. Nowhere to hide. We were prisoners of this deplorable human and he got off to our anguish. If you see Pho Cao on the way home from work on a sleep Sunday afternoon, turn around. Drive. Drive fast. Drive until you reach the ocean. Then start swimming. If there is a hell, I've been there. It is Pho Cao.
This is just about the only place I know where you can get a bowl of pho late.

Update to my last review: the management contacted me via Yelp the same day to apologize. Their chef mixed up the beef stew sourdough bread with the baguettes, which is why my sandwich was a disaster.  They offered to bring me back for another meal (on them) but unfortunately I had already left town. 

Kudos to them for taking customer satisfaction seriously! I'll try again when I'm back in town.
I went in for pho because our usual place was closed so we decided to try it ... Tastes less pho I got the stake I didn't like it never going back

Where do I even begin with this place. The entrance looks like it leads to a gambling den, the interior is like a pub on Sukharmvit in Bangkok. On to the food!

The Vietnamese Iced Coffee I order is bunk because the sweetened condensed milk is locked in the manager's office (what) ... the fried rice has eggshells in it and the meat in the pho tastes of freezer burn. The broth is middling, the noodles are clumped together and the cross-eyed lucky cat in the corner is telling me I made a mistake.

Not twice though.
Ordered the Vietnamese Sandwich, spring rolls (not fried), and seafood  Pho  which were  flavorful (broth is well made). Friendly staff, and quick service.

Awesome place and they open until very late! I was very hungry because I didn't eat dinner that day and I was able to make an order at 1am from my iPhone Yelp app. I went to pick up the food and the food taste really great! I totally recommends this place!

the set up is nice, but the food is awful.  I had chicken teriyaki and asked for noodles instead of white rice.  the chicken was slimy and it did not look or taste like chicken and the noodles were stuck together when I put my fork in them the whole bunch came up.  When I told them it was awful they still wanted to charge me full price.  They only gave me a 10% discount.  That's poor business I won't recommend or every eat there again.

Love the Buddha spring rolls. Best peanut sauce I have ever had. Crispy noodles hit the spot but my recommendation is to ask for extra sauce because it is delicious. 

Couple days ago I had the veggie pho and it was wonderful The main reason that I came back decides the kettle one mule which was one of the best mules I ever had

I order this place just about once a week now that it's cold from Door Dash. I always get the ramen and they never fail me! I always get my order in a timely fashion I know it's also door dash being on top of it but the restaurant too, they have to be sure the food is ready to go when they arrive. 
Pho Cao is just delicious, I've had some of their other entrees as well and this place taste authentic and it's perfect now for the chilly whether. Ordering from home or going in store either way it's yummy

The phó wasn't especially authentic, but it was pretty good. The service was fine as well. I don't remember my waiters name but he was nice. I intend on giving the place another chance but Phó Cao did not stand out to me.
Service great. Pho good. Atmosphere- weird in a good way. I'd come here again. Food came fast and exactly the way I wanted. Bartender/server fully aware of my needs and intuitive. Loved it.

Don't order the food... We went to watch a show here and I got really bad food poisoning from it. A couple family friends said the exact same thing. Drinks were okay, and the place looks very nice, so it's a shame that the food wasn't good and may have been handled improperly

Amazing pho and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone says it's a weird atmosphere but I love it because it's different, it's jazz music in a bar atmosphere with amazing food you can't go wrong here.

We love our pho.  Boyfriend had a taste for pho, we then googled the nearest places. Stopped by this place and quite surprised, live bands were playing, good sized bar, good menu choices and priced right. The spring rolls w/peanut sauce was good.  Our seafood pho was also very tasty. Was unsure about the place walking in, but all in all was good.

Got Pho here once and it was good!  Also had some tasty chicken wings and eggrolls.

Not sure what's going on inside the restaurant itself, it looks like it used to be a sports bar/party bar and now they serve pho and sushi?  I don't think I'd try the sushi here.

Lots of beers on tap, looks like a great spot for happy hour if you're near the 202 and Scottsdale Road in Tempe.
This place is great and open late. It's always nice to have a vietnamese restaurant open for those of us who love eating late.
I ate here on a rainy Sunday and the service was pretty terrible. Very slow throughout the process. The chicken pho was very tasty. The interior of the place needs a revival.
Best pho in town and killer atmosphere. I would happily write an extensive review written exclusively using pho puns but I'm too drunk thanks to the strong drinks and dope servers, especially Chris.

Best place ever. Victor is the man. Some friends and I had a party here and we were challenging guests: more people showed up than expected, we brought glitter and it got all over the floor, and we set up decorations all over the place. The staff was very accommodating and even offered smoke machines (which, of course, we took advantage of). They gave the birthday boy an awesome shirt as a present and let us bring in a dancer. Can't recommend this place enough. Great food, strong drinks, and fun karaoke on Thursdays.

This has been an awesome experience!  Not only were our pho and summer rolls the best we've had, Toan, our waiter, was amazing!!!  So polite, personable, and competent!  Yea, Toan!  Great, affordable wine, too!  See you in October, Toan:)
The waiter knew that this was our first time with Vietnamese food but still recommended the number one with tripe and tendon. My guest was very unhappy. We went to lunch elsewhere after she tasted it

The atmosphere: 
This is a hip little pho place. There was live music the evening we went. It was a variety of different genres. If you're looking for a quiet atmosphere, I'd recommend checking to see if they have live music that night. We went on a Sunday evening, and it was not ideal for conversation. 

The food:
The pho is awesome! If you're a vegan/vegetarian they have great options (including vegan broth), and the veggie pho has great flavor. The other pho variants were liked in the group as well. If you're a bloody Mary fan, they put a Vietnamese twist on it, and I highly recommend it. If you're looking for a pho place, look no further. 

The service:
In general the wait staff was pleasant, polite and eager to help. It seemed as though they were understaffed, but the servers were all accommodating and apologetic for the delays. Hopefully it was just an issue of being down a server.

In summary, great pho, hipster vibe (may not be great for conversation depending on the evening), service was ok.

I ordered takeout for my husband and I for dinner.  I really liked the vibe, I felt like I was in a neighborhood bar restaurant back in ny. Very refreshing to not be in your typical Scottsdale franchise.  I ordered at the bar, the bartender was friendly and very helpful. As I waited for my food I observed a mixed crowd. Family with a baby, college students ,older women chatting with me at the bar, while the band was warming up. It was very clean and comfortable. I ordered Salmon Spring Rolls  which was the only food item I didn't care for ,everything else was really good. I also had the pineapple fried rice which was served in  a pineapple! We also had the endamame Sauteed in garlic, chili and I think lemongrass . We also got spring rolls that were soo good and my husband got some fried rice dish with meat and he loved it! I'm so excited to have a great ethnic restaurant / bar in my neighborhood,  finally!

Let's start with it took ten minutes for us to be noticed by the one server there. The manager or what ever informed us that she was the only one working. We then received menus and ordered our food and drinks. We got a sake bomber which was cold sake served in a dirty glass. The glass was dirty so we showed it to the bartender and she gave us a new one which was still cold. We have never been served cold sake before so we weren't really sure what was up with that. We then got our food. The six dollar spring rolls were definitely not worth it. Just lettuce with a STOP of pork wrapped in rice paper. The pho was actually really good! We are our food the bartender was noticeably over whelmed forgetting my drink order but brought it right when I reminded her. Then we get the check. Keep in mind it was happy hour. Never have I been charged separately for beer and sake. 8 dollars all together. And my little 8 ounce mixed drink was nine dollars. When I showed her these were not happy hour prices she said they didn't have happy hour on weekends. It was Thursday. She then told us it was happy hour prices. Um 9 dollars a drink for happy hour?!? Needless to say I was not happy with my experience here and will not be coming back. Yes the pho was good, but pho than is better with better service. I would not waste your time here I felt like I was on AND episode of bar rescue.

This was good, If I have to criticize anything the broth was a bit weak other then that it was all very good. Walking into the place is not what you would expect, but I do like the vibe. A pho place that plays reggae while you watch anything from college ball to lord of the rings and apparently in Thursday's they have a stage for karaoke. lol I'm gonna have to try and catch that!

Very different atmosphere since it is a bar.  With tons of live music!  And the food is really good too!  The menu has more variety than expected and I'm definitely looking forward to trying out more from this neighborhood joint.  Also has a happy hour drink menu.

Awesome place, great atmosphere!!! They have music nightly, amazing value and the owner rocks!!! Best Vietnamese food in Arizona hands down! Seems like a great date spot or if you want to come have drinks with your friends.

I don't even want to give one star for this.

Just moved to Tempe and was really excited to find a pho restaurant so close. Was a little weirded out, nobody was there on a Friday night. Waiter was nice and we ordered 3 bowls of pho and I got a smoothie.

Smoothie was made with expired ROTTEN milk, the waiter said "Oh, well I smelled it to check if it was okay and it seemed fine." He said I wouldn't have to pay for it so I ordered a drink from the bar instead. Took a peek in there and found a nice live bug floating around on top. 

At this point we were all sick to our stomachs, didn't eat any of the pho they brought out because who knows what is floating around in there. I told the waiter about the bug, he sighed and said "Oh fuck". I just told him we were leaving and we still got charged for the pho we didn't eat.

All around terrible experience. Got to hold my sister's hair as she threw up from disgust when we got home! Thanks Pho Cao!

Not all pho restaurants are created equal and this place is no exception.  I can't complain though.  The servings are big and very filing. Atmosphere is kind of dark with black and orange painted walls but i can't rate them on the color of their walls everyone has different taste.  All in all this place is good I will be returning..oh!  And about pho soup being great for colds and hangovers. .this is so very true.

great price and excellent service 

tried chicken pho delicious !!

I enjoy visiting Pho Cao for Vietnamese food (Spring Rolls & Pho). 
I love the Live Music atmosphere. 
I go to Gypsy's Blues Jam on Tuesdays whenever I can. She's a gracious host & it's a fun jam! :)

Its a Pho Shop with many other things. They offer sushi here as well. They also do Karaoke live.

There is a dance floor with sofa seating and a couple of tables/booths. There is also a staging area.

The food is pretty good, big portions. I usually get the beef and meatball pho with spring rolls and my bf gets either the fried rice or the thick rice noodles with chicken. 

Ive come across this place because my family does parties here. Yes you can book parties at this restaurant, one other thing is that they remain open for the public if you are having the party. So the owner doesnt completely shut it down. 

On the weekends they are open until 2 am, for those craving late night pho or whatever. Since all other restuarants usualy closes by 10, you still have the option of coming here. 

The owner is very friendly and cool, and so if the staff.

Nice to have pho available late night but the music is so loud you can't even the person across from you. Food is decent it was nice to make my pho to my preferred level of spicy-ness. Pretty full bar, ample amount of seating, easy to locate and decent amount of parking. Still can't get over how loud it was though

This place is something else! And I mean that in the best of way possible! This place is not like any other place I have been to. Going around Tempe on one of my nightly Adventures. Looking for a place that's open late is hard to come by, stepping upon this pho place that's open till 2 am is a stop we'll make. Wasn't to sure at first, but hey minus well give it a try and may I say I'm glad I did. Walking into the place I was amazed. Cause it's not only a pho place but a bar and karaoke place! I was amazed, cause it's like killing two birds with one stone. I enjoy eating pho and singing as well so you can say the first time experience here was amazingly great. The good was yummy! And their Thai iced tea hit the spot! I added a scoop of ice cream in it and it was beyond yummy! I didn't mind the extra price at all. Besides the food and the first impression I got from the place. The customer service is great. We were seated by a gentlemen who had took his time to seat us even if he clocked out for the day. And our waitress was super nice, I just wish there were more waitresses out there just like her.  She answered all my questions and not once looked annoyed or anything just patient and understanding. If your looking for a pho place that's open late, fun, relaxing, and has yummy food. This is the place to be :)!! You won't regret it.

I came here this evening to get dinner after swim practice at the Sun Devil Fitness Complex. It's easy enough to get to from ASU, as it's pretty much right beside the 202, just a quick turn from Scottsdale Rd. Upon entering, you'd think this is more of a bar and grill than a pho restaurant, but it really is both of these. I was immediately seated and given a glass of water and  a menu. I ordered the soft spring rolls and the salted fish fried rice, and didn't have to wait long before the food arrived at my table. Both were very good and the food here is quite inexpensive, comparable to most pho places in the Valley. Service was fast and efficient, and I'm definitely looking forward to coming here again for dinner, as the quality and quantity of food are a good match for my hunger after the strenuous swim team workouts at the nearby SDFC. And contrary to what one reviewer stated in her review, this place is definitely not shutting down; in his response, the owner has sufficiently explained why she misinterpreted what she saw and experienced during her visit.

Just got the best spicy pho. Just what I needed with a head cold and a rainy evening. Love that I can assemble it myself at home and add ALL THE CHILI. 

Very nice and FAST service and told me about all the music nights they have (different theme every night with Monday's dark). 

I'll definitely return to dine-in!

Be prepared for live music with full bands either on or closer to the weekend. If you're looking for a nice quiet pho place to take your family or sweetie, not exactly the place. The broth is a little sweeter and all the add-ins are fresh.

I tried ordering with them online through yelp, out of no where I have multiple charges coming from San Francisco for uber and numerous things DO NOT use your card with this place because it looks like they're trying to do some carding fraud it may not be the owner but it's definitely a employee or something pay cash
Wow. Sooooo yummy Pho, Shrimp with Pork, Thai Tea, Edamame and Orange Chicken. No complaints at all and really enjoyed it. We will be back.

I absolutely love this restaurant because I am able to order phõ with vegetable with a vegetable based broth. The servers are always full of energy and knowledgeable. The best part is they serve incredibly late and they are located next to Bosa Donuts, so if you need something sweet you can head next foor

This place was a dissapointment. It smells inside, but my fiance and I decided to give it a chance since it was highly recommended. My fiance ordered pho and I ordered the yellow curry. The beer was flat and the broth in my dish was watered down. It wasnt worth the money we spent and we would not go there again.
Food is decent, not the best but will do. Atmosphere seemed a bit off or lost, service is slow and waiters are forgetful but friendly. Decent portion and price however.
I'm Vietnamese and this restaurant is great. The boss is super cool and their food is good. Go here for your pho needs. Oh and they're open 24hrs :D
Missed the band.  Flat beer.  No roses lime juice.  Great staff and a cool crowd.  Wish WWF got here earlier.  Will come back.
Great service. Bomb Pho!!! Always my favorite go to food when I'm just hungry and not craving anything...

We tried to go to a Pho place that was recommended to us by a friend but was closed. Did a quick yelp search and found this place that had just opened. 

It was pretty empty at 1pm with only 4 tables occupied. Service was good except the kitchen messed up on our orders which is hard to believe as, with most Pho places, it's order by number. No biggie, the fixed it. 

On to the Pho itself. First the size. The regular and large are not much different and the large is smaller then most place I've gone. The broth itself was OK but not anything special. The meat was lacking, not in quality but quantity. Overall it was a decent bowl of Pho but not something I would drive to in order to have. If I was in the area and needed a quick Pho fix, sure, but nothing more.

something about this place is odd.  it is right off the freeway, tucked in a corner next to a hotel. 
got spring rolls, egg rolls, shaken beef, and vermicilli.  egg rolls were quite good, wrapped with a lettuce and dipped into fish sauce.  spring rolls were mehhhhh. and its hard to go wrong with spring rolls.
vermicilli had lots of fatty pieces of meat...ill pass

the vietnamese iced coffee was probably the best thing we got.

they have a full bar. and a sushi bar, but no sushi...

I was having an oil change nearby so I checked the reviews of this place and decided to give it a try.  I will say that the place has a bad odor when you walk in.  Kind of smells like a stinky old bar.  Certainly not very appetizing.

 I ordered the ramen noodle pho to try something different.  The pho comes with rare steak and brisket, ramen noodles, and a boiled egg.  The broth was pretty nice and the meat was fairly decent.  However, the cilantro and basil on the side looked as if it came out of the trash or the alley behind the restaurant.  Very poor quality, dry and wilted.  I would have liked to have tried the fresh spring rolls, but they were a little pricey.  They were double what I am used to paying at other Vietnamese places in the area.

Finally, there was a charge to use my credit card, which was not posted anywhere.  I had cash, but by the time I checked my receipt, it was too late to change it.

Pho cao dao from Cali will never top any pho I'll ever eat but surprisingly I enjoyed the pho from this resto. The noodles were fresh and their crispy rolls was cooked to perfection. Definitely would come back again! Yum!

Worst experience ever hair in the rice, cold tea, cold food, diarrhea for the day, waitress argued the fact that the tea water was mad by the morning crew...it was 7:30 pm. Spoke with the manager Victor for an adjustment, was told if I removed my review. U take the chance if u dare!

Comfortable atmosphere and Great Vietnamese food!!  Their Pho broth is one of the best I've had in town, and is always so fresh and delicious.  Besides the pho, the also have some fantastic rice dishes.  The Shaken Beef (Bo Luc Lac) is incredible; chopped cubes of filet mignon cooked with onions and peppers.  The sliced BBQ Pork and Grilled Shrimp plate is excellent as well.  I'd also recommend saving some room for dessert and get the Coconut ice cream, which they serve in a fresh coconut with a chilled glass of the Coconut milk on the side.  If you'd like a new Vietnamese restaurant, look no further .
Just went to this place the food was really good and the staff was very friendly.  I ordered the ramen dish with a side of white rice. The food was served in less than 10 minutes and was super hot.

I'm here right now. It's my first time. My friends took me her for my birthday. Service was great! Food was okay. Being Vietnamese everything tasted on the bland side.. The main reason why I gave this place a 2 star is we came here on Thursday for karaoke .. You write your name on a list to wait in line. I got a chance to sing my song and my friends we right behind me on the list but for some reason they didn't get to sing after me.. So I was confused.. I believe the DJ for the karaoke puts up people he know and regulars first before us.. Which is a totally unfair and bias. I don't get how a restaurant will gain new regulars when they do this to new people. Probably will be my first and last time here. Was a fun spot til that happened. :/
Place to come for Pho and live music. The servers are very friendly. Please is clean and prices

I've been to Pho Cao many times and have always enjoyed my experience! My girlfriend and I love the PHO and Saki Bombers! I'm kind of new to Yelp and don't usually leave reviews unless it deserving and Pho Cao is as good as it gets if your looking for Vietnamese food that is priced right!

This was my first time eating Pho. My girlfriend and I had such a great first impression here and I definitely know we'll be back soon.

We walked in to what seemed to be a side entrance to the restaurant. The bartender that was working was extremely polite, professional, and a hard worker. He greeted us as soon as we walked in, explained what Pho was when we asked, and gave us some iced water with lemon as we waited for our order. We put in a to-go order and the food came out very quickly. 

I have a feeling that my girlfriend will be begging me to come back to Pho Cao soon!

Ok...so we wanted quick,  healthy, yummy. Something to feed a CARNIVORE and a VEGAN.

This place was BEYOND good and met EVERY demand.

We were initially a little put off by the lack of windows and side entrance.  When we walked in, our eyes needed to adjust to the dim lighting.  Little did we know how quickly it would happen and what AMAZING epicurean adventures awaited us.

Take a chance.... this place is AWESOME!!!

I've been a regular for the past 3 years. I came in to new location order lollipop Wings only to be disappointed they came and we're regular typical wings nothing special and definitely not lollipop wings? Came back a couple weeks later normally they have the very best broth for Pho very rich and full of flavor. Again I was disappointed it tasted like tap water that was over chlorinated. Never have I had a problem with the Pho before. Hopefully they pull it together and get consistent as far as food quality and service.

I've only been here twice. 

The first time around, I was actually picking up a to-go order for my daughter, who was ill at that time.

The second time, we stopped by here after having spent nearly all day at the Scottsdale Pavilions doing indoor skydiving and go-karting.

It was open mic night, and there were a few performers exhibiting their guitar prowess. 

To be honest, this place is a dive. If we dined here with that mindset, we wouldn't have had such an issue with the Pho that we had ordered.

We often sample a new Pho place each month; therefore, we are pretty well versed as to what to expect as far as texture and flavor. 

However, we became very concerned with the actual texture of what was being passed as beef. It didn't look like real beef. And it didn't taste like real beef. It actually had the appearance of a frozen beef packet that was summarily boiled.

And the Pho itself didn't have the tangy flavor that we were accustomed to. 

Couple that with the lack of utensils, and our inability to actually get the attention of a server that wasn't distracted by the event. It didn't make for a good impression regarding our dine-in experience.

I did give this place two stars because the local talent they had were actually quite entertaining and provided some levity from our dissatisfaction with both the food and the service.

Easy, seamless ordering through yelp's online service. Order was confirmed within 10 min and set to be ready 10 min after that. There was a short wait when we got there for pickup, but the staff was apologetic and did their best to hurry things along. Minus 1 star for the amount of chicken in the Pho Ga (seemed a little skimpy) but the broth was incredible and the overall taste profile knocked it out of the park. We will certainly be going back, and may even do dine in to check out some of their live music.

Fun place.  Went there for the first with a couple friends on a Thurs. night for karaoke and some drinks.  We generally go to various karaoke bars in the east valley and wanted to give this one a shot.  Crowd was definitely a 20's crowd, however I think there was a special celebration going on that night that brought in the big group.  

Phil does karaoke on Thurs nights there and he always does a great job.  Drink prices were reasonable but nothing to brag about.  Will probably venture back there again.

I took my girl friend out for our anniversary to have lunch at Pho Cao.  We were greeted right away and seated at the window booth. We ordered salmon spring rolls and summer rolls as appetizers.  My girl friend raved about how delicious they were. For entrees we ordered filet mignon shaken beef and Pho dac biet (Pho Cao).  The beef was tender and tasty.  The pho was delicious--the best broth I've ever had. The taste of the beef broth is hard to find in many other pho restaurants.  The service was excellent.  The server Natalie was very attentive and came to check on us if we needed anything during our meal.  She even suggested the berry smoothies for dessert.  My girl and I loved it so much that we ordered another one for to-go.  The total bill was $38 dollars.  $38 is very cheap for the quality of food and the service we received.  We always spend at least $70 or more for two when we order appetizers, entrees and desserts.  

We also learned that Pho Cao is only place open 'til 2:00 am for Pho in the valley.  We'll definitely be back to get some late night pho.  I would highly recommend Pho Cao to anyone looking for some quality Pho.

If I could give a negative star, I would.  Dirty/dark old bar. Ordered Saki, glass were filthy and dingy. Menu prices are higher than the online price lists. Owner had excuses to give his staff, but wouldn't come out and speak with us. 
We eat Pho weekly, in Seattle.  This was disgusting and an embarrassment to anything Pho. Even the waitress said she prefers eating Pho anywhere else. 
I would never return or recommend this place to anyone!

To be honest the decor is bizarre. And the service CAN be questionable along with the live music. Not your typical Vietnamese restaurant that's for certain, but the food is always always delicious. Great pho always and very consistent. Potstickers and crispy egg roles are to die for! If you can keep an open mind and don't let the surroundings rub you the wrong way I definitely recommend.

I am was excited to see a Pho place opening so close to my job, but this was one of the most disappointing experiences I've ever had! We were able to order right away, but watched 4 tables come in, get seated and served their food before we got our pho. We waited for 40 minutes before we got flavorless pho that was only very warm. The noodles in mine were undercooked yet the veggies were overlooked. One of the people that came in ordered, ate and paid in about 30 minutes, while we couldn't even get our change from out bill after being there for 2 hours! I will never come here again and tell everyone I know to avoid this place because you're going to wait 5 times longer than other guests for the most tasteless pho of your life!

2 words.......HIDDEN JEM

If I lived closer to this joint I would be here every single night. We came in for a Sunday night open Mic.....cool atmosphere, great bartender. My wife had some noodles or ramen, next time we'll bring our appetites. 
Great bar and staff.  KEEP UP THE LIVE MUSIC!!!!!

Up and running!

PHO CAO opened up this week in my neighborhood, I was hoping someone would take over the former Longshots and do something cool with it. Well some one did take it over and transplanted a Vietnamese Rock and Roll nightclub/restaurant. 

If you go, know this they haven't finished the place yet, at least I hope not. A severe lack of attention to detail persist through out this cavernous space.

Here are several observations on this Transplant in my hood.

1 I was hoping for better
2 Clean this place up, they need to hire a girl that likes to clean. All dudes on staff.
3 lighting is horrendous I hope they take a strong look at that and make some changes 
4 Do something with that bar, your liquor looks old and very disorganized, It's massively inefficient.
5 I hope the food improves my dish was just ok, I have heard great things just haven't tasted them yet. btw my order was incorrect but after we established the waiter misunderstood me and it wasn't made for someone else I insisted I keep it.
6 They need some bike racks lots of them, and light them up, Trust me on this.
7 I hope the smokers find a better place to smoke then just outside the front door.
8 This place actually needs a front door! The tiny black dirty metal door is not welcoming at all. They should drop a few bucks there for sure. in the interim put a plant, a porch light, and a rug there so customers don't have to guess how to enter. If it weren't for the smokers It would have taken more effort to find it.
9 Get a real website if they had a contact us, this would have been sent in private.

Positives
1 Live Music
2 Take out and delivery
3 Late Night Hours
4 Service was pretty good
5 This place has potential if the owners don't rest on past reputation and pay attention to details.
6 Great location on McDowell and 74th st. When the apartments are finished this place will be jumping.

I will return because I know it will be better then it was.

Ordered some Pho, but the server forgot to mention they were out of some meat and served the meal anyways without thinking id not notice.

They do have decent food, but i dont stand for dishonesty.
If they would at least told me the meat was out before they made the dish, id actually go back.
Still charged me the full price anyways...

First time here, had the fried spring rolls and the soft summer rolls which were good. Also the rice noodles w/beef and the special fried rice was delicious. The place was definitely a dive, a bar turned into a Vietnamese rstrnt., Very little natural lighting (lack of windows) there even was a pool table. Would I go back? Sure if in the neighborhood!!!

The pho was ok. However I definitely appreciate that they were open late on a Sunday night. The service was good, our server was very attentive the whole time we were there. The live music was pleasantly surprising. It was a bit loud when we arrived but definitely improved as different people took the stage. Over all it's a fun place.

One of my new favorites in Tempe.  Great broth, eggrolls, and the fact that they have a full bar makes me want to come for dinner too.  Being from Hawaii, and having pho be part of my weekly meal, it's important to search out the best of the best.  This will definitely be my place when I have a craving and find myself in Tempe!
Like the food, but hate the karaoke. Still, it's a worthwhile tradeoff for late-night Vietnamese.

I love this place! It's kind of different they have entertainment, it's kind of dark inside but the food is outstanding, prices are good and staff is great! In fact I'm going again tonight. I checked groupon but unfortunately found none. Please get hooked up with groupon. See you tonight!

2018 and I've hit the first pho spot that has sent me to the heavens, good lord... 

First off: lunch special comes with 3 potstickers and a large bowl of pho. steal

Lucas, is a great server unique personality,  
I'm probably coming back here before I leave please eat here
