We usually eat china wok but wanted to try something else. The fried rice was over fried, didn't taste fresh at all. The egg rolls weren't good. We had pot stickers and a spring roll as well. Overall I was very unhappy. I'll stick to my usual spot next time, the food is better and so is the price.

Everything was surprisingly good I don't like pho but I was pleasantly surprised when I had theirs they also have really good spring rolls I will return servers were excellent and very kind and help me decide what to order
It was good enjoyed the pho and it was a little to quite for my taste.. would like some music.. but was awesome enjoyed lunch here..
Great choice for Pho!  I swear the wait staff has been different every trip, and the last guy was horrible..  But everyone else has been great, so I'll write off the last experience as a fluke.

Be careful of what you order because everything is cooked in the same wok. 

I'm actually really disappointed. I read so many good reviews about this place that the food was phenomenal. But when we showed up and inform the waitress that my date has a terrible allergy to shrimp and asked if there was anyway to have her meal prepared in a way that there was no cross contamination. We were informed that wasn't possible. 
We asked about the vegan broth, but were informed that everything goes all in the same wok so cross contamination was going to happen. 

You even advertised that if you had a food allergy to let the wait staff know and they will accommodate your needs. This didn't happen and we had no other option but to leave and go some place else. 

Frankly I'm just straight up perplexed and disgusted at the casual disregard for people with any type of food allergy.

I work late sometimes and I have a hard time finding a place that will cater to the night owl such as myself. 

Pho Cao was convenient and stayed open late. Their menu was vast and delicious. Darina, or waitress, was on point with making sure our experience was the best that it could be. She made sure our drinks were filled and our empty plates cleared.

Their Pho was great being seasoned to perfection. 

I will be visiting this place more and broaden my palate with the rest of their menu.
The food is consistently good. The staff is friendly and attentive. The live music on Sunday's is entertaining. If I didn't live an hour away, I'd come more often. Love this place.

Attention Gluten Free'ers... This place is a paradise for those of us consuming a sans gluten diet. That said, the food was amazing the service was outstanding and did I mention almost EVERYTHING is GLUTEN FREE. The broth they use for the Pho is spectacular. We all had something different and dish after dish; pork, steak, shrimp, and vegetarian just kept getting better. Please make your palate happy and eat at Pho Cao.

This is by far my favorite Pho place in all of Scottsdale and Phoenix! I had the ramen Pho and it was perfect this is the only place that I heard of that offers ramen noodles in pho broth. I have had a lot of Pho and the broth here is fantastic. Basil, lime, sprouts, onions, and cilantro were so fresh it looks like they picked the herbs right before they sent it out the door. Awesome customer service and the food was delivered hot and 30min before expected. Thank you to Pho Cao and doordash for an amazing experience!

Excellent food, I order out a lot and they always get it right. It's alittle pricey but it's the best! Always  fun to see the live bands when we have the time and not on the take out "go". Thanks again!
Best ramen soup for the price anywhere. Highly recommend. I'm addicted to this place.

This place took my Pho virginity... and it was good.

I was initially excited when I sat down by the awesome playlist of old school hip hop playing in the background- it instantly put me in a good mood. The owner visited with us, and made some suggestions as this was my first time having Pho. I started with some spring rolls that they made to be vegetarian that tasted AMAZING. Perfect peanut sauce, and they replaced the meat with avocado and tofu. The taste hit the spot. 

Next, I opted for veggie pho, which I was a little disappointed to find out that it was still a beef broth base, but I tried it anyway and it was delicious. They served it with a side of fresh bean sprouts, mint and a lime. So many different flavors, yet they all complimented one another.

I treated myself to a Thai iced tea, which honestly was one of the best I've ever had. Sweet, but without the smokey aftertaste that some Thai teas can have (which I hate- so I don't always order them). It came with some boba which was a fun addition.

 I really hope this place does well, as the food, service and atmosphere were all great. I hear they are thinking about doing karaoke and I totally hope they do. I'll be back!

I came here for lunch with a friend. I ordered their Pho Gah. The atmosphere is similar to a dive bar atmosphere, not your typical Pho place. I read other reviews ahead of time saying this but took the chance since the first Pho option we wanted was closed. 

When we walked in a server/hostess told us to sit anywhere we'd like. Every booth seemed to have an empty glass or finished plate (about 3 or 4 empty booths like this) besides those currently occupied. We opted for a two person table instead. One of our chairs was sticky and so was the menu. 

The food itself was ok. I judge Pho by the chicken, this chicken seemed liked it was canned and not fresh. They do serve coconuts though, if you are thirsty or Jasmine tea. That is if you don't want alcohol from the bar. I ordered tea, but I didn't realize they planned on bringing it cold when I prefer hot. Though, I wasn't asked a preference either way. 

I would eat here again, it's just not my first choice for Pho.

Passed by this place several times after recently moving to the area. Looked like it had a good amount of business most days so it must be good. I was sadly mistaken...

The decor in this place is a bit of an eyesore. There is a bar, some tables and booths, a pool area, what looks like stage for live music or karaoke. Very dimly lit and dirty/grungy feeling. 

Our waitress was very odd as well. Not very friendly and didn't seem to have any knowledge of the menu. When asking questions about it she didn't really have an answer. The food is not very good and is an odd mix of Vietnamese, and American Chinese. Every thing the pit group ordered was just bland and lacked any creativity.

Probably won't be coming back...

Was excited to see this place open within walking distance of my apartment and decided to check it out. First thing you notice (or not notice) is the entrance. A side door, hardly marketed and hard to see. Once inside we were greeted by a server who informed us we could sit wherever we liked. We chose a booth in the corner of the raised area. There was a karaoke dj and a few large groups obviously there for the karaoke. The atmosphere was dark and stale. I ordered spring rolls and a regular steak pho. The rolls were nothing but filler and a few shreds of pork and a shrimp or two. They literally stuck to the plate. The pho came and my disappointment grew as I discovered 4 or less pieces of actual meat and far too few noodles to even out the amount of broth. Overall a disappointment. Would have rated one star but our server was prompt and friendly.

So many overpriced douchey places are popping up in our valley. Pho Cao is not one of them!   This is the real deal. Great food served late for a steal. This is the type of place that has launched AZ musicians. See the next Gonna Blossoms/ RCP before they hit it big. Not a strip mall joint, not some corporate crap; a small stage with great sound!  Delicious 8-15 buck plates and full bar too. Oh yeah, lots of parking too.

This is going to be dangerous having a Pho place this close to my house that's open until 2am.  

I went due to a Groupon and now will be a steady regular.  The Pho is one of the best I've had in the valley.  I sampled it before I doctored it up with sauces and it was full of flavor and would've been great as is, but I like it spicy so I add quite a bit of Siracha and chili flakes.  

I ordered the Pho Tai large which was a HUGE 50oz bowl with plenty of noodles and meat.  I also got the crispy vietnamese egg rolls which came as an order of 4 and were excellent.  

The service was very good never had to ask for a water refill or wait long for ordering or to get food.  

Overall this place is great I have not had the experience I see with others on here and hope I never do because this place will for sure be in my regular rotation.

The food is so yum O!!! Everything I have tried is amazing!!! I love pho and I gotta tell ya the magic is in the broth. When I'm feeling down or feel sickness coming on, pho is my go to comfort food. The broth can heal a broken heart :) The spring rolls are fresh and creative. I usually go with the shrimp and pork but recently tried the avocado and tofu, they were so good. My friend ordered the shaken beef stir fry. She was surprised and pleased with her dish. Marinated filet mignon, fresh sautéed vegetables, and jasmine rice. I stole a couple of bites and definitely decided that's what im ordering next time. The prices are great for the amount of food your served. The staff is awesome and are always willing to accommodate. I think it was meant to be, that they opened up right down the street from me. It's my favorite place to go for cocktails and food. They have a great happy hour and reverse happy hour, 1/2 off drinks and discounts on appetizers.

What a delightful surprise!  Honestly, if you're just driving by, at best, it looks like a small dive bar but treasures await inside for Foodies!
We ordered takeout and ordered a drink while waiting.  If you're searching for epic cocktails - forget it.  The wine is poured out of those little airport bottles (for freshness? ) but unlike the airlines it was only $4.
That said, the locals, the service (Lucas was the perfect host, bartender, and server), and the food was awesome.  While we pondered the menu an enormous plated ice cream extravaganza was delivered to the couple next to us and it could've easily been served at a fine dining restaurant.  
Once home, the Shaken Beef was divine with tender, abundant filet mignon/veggies in the most delicious sauce.  It honestly is the best pepper steak I've ever had.  My friend thoroughly enjoyed the Buddha Spring Rolls.  Even the chicken fried rice stood out with large chunks of perfectly cooked chicken and good flavor.
There is easy parking, karaoke, cheap drinks, and again - Incredible food!
Who would have guessed, a Vietnamese food sports bar.  And the food is really good.  Authentic and fresh.  I'll be back for sure.

I was a little hesitant to come after my friend got food poisoning from here but saw this was the only place with vegetarian pho + broth. I was initially thrown off when walking in because it doesn't look like a typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's actually a bar that sells Vietnamese food. The server was really nice and the food was decent. And the spring rolls were on the smaller side but still tasty.

What a nice little surprise. A bit of a strange atmosphere, but fun. I knocked a star off because it smells like stale cigarettes and is a bit outdated.
We've had lunch here several times, great! 
First night we tried to come there was some sort of "Death Metal" band playing and there was a huge crowd, on night 2 was Christmas Karaoke.
Food is Excellent, super service every time we go there. Great Pandora channel playing during lunch.
We'll see you again tomorrow.

I really enjoy this place! I have been a few times and I am always greeted as soon as I walk in the door and receive great service from there.

I typically sit at the bar since I am usually with only one other guest for a bite and a drink and we always enjoy trying new drinks and hearing their specialties.  A few times, the manager (or maybe even owner?) has come out to to visit and ask how our experience is going.  I feel they truly care about their service and quality of food, which sadly is rare these days.

The chicken curry is ALWAYS amazing, as well as the #28, Com Bo Luc Luc (which was recommended to my friend by the manager/owner)

Never disappointed! Give it a chance and I am sure you will be back!

If getting bent over and financially taken for some sub par plastic noodles and boiling hot water is what you need, this place is for you. To top it off you'll get to listen to blasting loud karaoke being sung horribly by some sad man walking around the whole place and horribly un attended by the clueless waitstaff. I hope you come with alot of money and prepared to burn hours away for some horrible soup.
Great environment, fun happy hours, and great food.  The management wants to make sure you're happy.

This place is the MUTHA-PHO-CAO!
We came here on a whim since I've been craving pho.
My boyfriend was very hesitant to eat here but decided "happy wife..happy life". Boy wasn't he happy after he finished devouring the Mongolian beef! I had the pho tai and potstickers.
This place definitely has great potential for a late night night cap that's close to home.

Why in the world would they automate the menu on their website to scroll every 10 seconds. It seems like they ought to fire their web coder. Couldn't decide what to eat because everytime I'm reading the menu items, it's changing the menu page on me. So just decided to go to Saigon Bowl, their menu doesn't skip out on me as I'm trying to make a selection.

Woah this is a Vietnamese Pho + Karaoke + Bar + Live Stage combo, a triple whammy!

The venue is definitely conducive to a good time. The selection of alcohol (lots of local beers on tap, large wine list, great cocktails) coupled with a bomb stage and lots of lounging spaces (leather sofas and the like) were great staples that took our regular night out to a new level. They even have a fancy disco ball lighting gizmo and a miniature DJ station. Did I mention this is a Pho place? 

The karaoke is intense. They have virtually every song imaginable nestled in a big black greasy book. They even have Tom Jones' Sexbomb, which is the sorta the soundtrack to my life and the only song that will get my ass on stage. Needless to say, we had a great time.

The food was four stars tops. The Pho is solid but won't blow you away. I had the Pho Ga--Chicken ($6.75 for a small). Don't be fooled by the word "small," they have huge portions. Like, huge. The appetizers are good too: I was a fan of the fried calamari and the crispy spring rolls.

-----

Distinguishing Factor: So much more than a Pho restaurant. More like Pho-n venue.
Eh...If in Tempe, go to Khai Hoan for Vietnamese. The only thing this place has is it's late night hours (open until 2a on weekend).

Ive tried this place twice now, and Ive yet to be terribly impressed. I absolutely love quality PHO and both trips to Pho Cao have made me wish I had went to my usual spot on the west side. I live in Old Town so this spot is convenient, but not much more than that. Service is ALWAYS slow, and forgetful. I have visited the old spot by the freeway, and now the new spot off of McDowell and both places were dark, dank and dive-y. I can appreciate a good dive bar, and even hole-in-the-wall type places, but this place seems to miss the mark on both. The Pho broth tastes like ramen broth. It isnt clear like good, slow simmered pho both is supposed to be. Pho Cao's broth is brown and the noodles are always clumped together in a ball at the bottom of the bowl. The spring rolls are decent but the peanut sauce is def from a jar. Its overtly sweet and tastes more like a peanut butter paste than sauce. Like I said, its not horrible, its just not a genuine pho restaurant. This is a karaoke joint that services hipsters who want to think they are eating genuine pho. Service is slow, and food is mediocre. I doubt I will return.

I really, really wanted to like this place. I've only had pho one other time, and was looking forward to trying it again.

I went on a Friday night when it wasn't terribly busy. My main complaint was the service. First of all, our server kept coming back to our table, seeming like he was getting increasingly irritated that we were taking our time to order. 
I ordered vegetarian egg rolls as an appetizer. I'm not sure what happened, if the server just wasn't listening to me-but he said "Buddha rolls" which I assumed was some official name for said egg rolls, so I said yes.  Apparently I had just ordered spring rolls without even realizing. Sure, that was a miss communication-however it could have easily been resolved without telling me that I didn't order egg rolls (which I had). I hate to play the customer is always right card, but in this case-I have to. I had to practically argue my way to getting my order corrected. I felt like my server was treating me as if I was just lying to be difficult. 

It's really sad because our food was really good. I enjoyed my veggie pho and eggrolls. My boyfriend, who came with, enjoyed his meal as well.

When the bill came, it looked as though our server had just charged us for the spring rolls anyway in addition to the veggie rolls. My temper had already flared enough at that point so I had my boyfriend handle it. Apparently he was "going to fix our bill"..well if you were going to fix it, why didn't you do that before setting the check on the table?!?!?! 

I don't predict a return visit, not at least in the near future.

Everything I wanted with this place happened. Finally a decent dive bar in Scottsdale. Great for a few friends to enjoy decent food and drink in a great atmosphere. Food $7-$12. Drinks $2.75-$8. I love that they have live music almost every night of the week.

I've been there a few times on weekdays and it was very good considering I don't often eat Vietnamese food. Spring Rolls were very good and the Pho, which I've never had before, was good as well. They also have pretty good happy hour deals. I'll be back.

Not really the standard pho place. It's a great place if you also want to hear live bands. Our last experience was great with a few new singers, amazing talent. Food is really good, the large bowl is quite large so my husband always orders the small and is full. Recommend trying the spring rolls and combination pho, it only comes in the large bowl so be hungry when you order.

Love this hole in the wall, late night open, yummy pho place. This place is great for a hangover. There are no windows in the place - full bar - and it's got fast and friendly service. In the evenings there's live music of all kinds which is always fun and interesting! (Except for Monday's) The Tamarind broth is super good if your looking to spice up your pho experience! It's spicy! 
This place is great to go just by yourself or with a big group.

Biggest rip off ever. Boyfriend went in to pick up for us. We got the salmon spring rolls. They totally sucked. And claimed to have all these ingredients and all it came with was lettuce and salmon. No avocado, nothing. My pho was fine. But online it was supposed to be 9.50 with all my add ins and it came out to 17.50. Complete ripoff. And my boyfriend got an entree with steak and shrimp. Tiny portion of steak and three tiny shrimp. 12 dollars. Sooooo ridiculous. Never going back. Otherwise the restaurant itself looks cool inside but would not recommend eating there if you want to get what you pay for BC you pay a lot and get nothing.

I'm so glad Pho Cao is reopened- and closer to my house! Food is as great as before, service is better than before. Couldn't be happier! Well, unless they got their website and online ordering back up and running. But still- 5 stars!

So I've been hearing lots about the new pho cao that opened in my neighborhood and was very excited to try it out. But I was even more excited when I found out they have VEGAN pho!!!! Yes! Since I don't eat beef, it's hard to find pho places that serve this yummy hot soup beef-less since its traditionally a beef based soup. And let me tell you this vegan broth was awesome! I ordered the seafood pho but with vegan broth and it was delicious, filled with mushrooms and carrots too! Yumm yum! A bit over- priced compared to other pho spots but worth it if you are a non-beef pho lover!

I was driving one day and noticed that Pho Cao is now in the neighborhood. Being constantly on the lookout for something new, I went in for lunch. Service was friendly, I was seated immediately, and I spent some time studying the menu.

I really wanted to like this place...

The restaurant itself is sort of dark and heavy with the dark walls and dark unfinished floor, and there is nothing to diminish the noise that reverberates off the walls and floor. I knew that if I returned here, it wouldn't be for the setting.

The server did check with me several times before I was ready to order, but I was glad he was paying attention. I decided on E17, Charbroiled pork and eggroll with vermicelli. The dish was very bland, and I found myself trying to flavor it up with Hoisin and Soy Sauce. That didn't work very well, so when I finally got someone's attention, I paid, and left most of my food behind. All though they weren't very busy, no one seemed concerned enough to ask me how my food was. 

I decided a few days later to give it another try, that perhaps I should have guessed E17 would be bland. I wanted to like this place. 

I entered, and was struck once again by the lack of atmosphere of any sort. it just feels like a big dive. This time I ordered two things to be fair, and I stuck with items I had read good things about in their ratings. I ordered the A5 Fried Chicken Pot stickers, and the P2 Steak Pho and sat back ready to have a better meal than on my previous visit. 

The Pot Stickers were a generous portion, but the filling didn't offer up much flavor, and the dipping sauce just came off flat, not really enhancing the fried dumpling, the outside of which was hard rather than crisp. The Pho also didn't yield much flavor, even with all of the fresh ingredients added.

The portions were generous, but without any richness of flavor, I just got tired of eating and requested my check. I'll note that just as on my first visit, no one ever checked back after delivering my food to me to see if it was to my liking.

A further challenge on my second visit was that a young family of about 8 came in with their small child. In addition to the loudness of their voices in the room with nothing to break the sound, the squalling child, who they made no attempt to placate or entertain, completed my experience of - no, I don't need to try this again.

Maybe I'm getting it all backwards, and being open for lunch is done on a whim, and they really want to be a loud, fun evening entertainment venue that happens to have food. The concept may have alluded me. I'm sorry I couldn't like it. 

The food wasn't horrible. Everything was very fresh. It just wasn't that tasty.  Also, at no point during either visit did I smell any food cooking.

Pho Cao just moved to our neighborhood so we decided to check it out and we're glad we did. We tried the fried tofu and the spicy mayo served with it was ok but we asked our server to bring peanut sauce and that was awesome. The dumplings had a delicious filling and great sauce as well. There was also hoison sauce, soy and sriracha on the table. I love sauces so I was in heaven! Jessica was our server and she was super nice, attentive and helpful with the menu. I got the chicken and veggies on egg noodles but....I added chinese sausage, which is my favorite!  It was really flavorful and there were a lot of veggies including bok choy, cabbage, onion, carrot etc...my main complaint was the music. Although it was jazz and not a bad band at all, it was just too loud.

I drove by Pho this week & couldn't wait to try it!

Came back tonight for Sunday dinner around 6pm.

There was live music and a seat yourself atmosphere.

The inside surprised me, because it's basically an old dive bar. 

We searched for a booth, but they were mostly dirty.

I noticed a girl slowly attempting to clear tables. Like 1 cup at a time.

Once we sat at a booth for 8, the only option for our family of 3, she stopped cleaning the other booths.

The menu was extensive with lots of Asian cuisine, random American food of fries & wings, and of course Pho.

The food & service was pretty quick. The food was warm and tasty. 

As we sat and ate, it was odd to me, as an ex-waitress, how short staffed the place seemed and how long tables stayed dirty.

I watched a waiter walk up to a dirty table next to us and clear off 1 fork. Only. Then shake his head at the rest.

Our waitress was nice, but literally ran around and shouted responses to customers, "seat your self" "Walk up to the bar" 
And looked pained when I asked for an extra plate for my son.

It was the kind of service that wasn't terrible, but didn't leave room for 5 stars, because they were running around crazy.

The music, at 6pm dinner, was also kind of terrible. Filled with swearing & bad Croning.

While the food was pretty decent, the dark atmosphere, random music and hardly cleanly spaces make me think I most likely won't be back.

I ordered takeout for the seafood dish. I wasn't that impressed with the crispy noodles, but the quality of the seafood was high. And the steamed veggies that are included with the dish were very flavorable. It's expensive but worth the additional expense if you're looking for high quality vietnamese food.

there was a reunion party thing going on for a group of people in their 50s-70s when we arrived for dinner. we also had no clue that it was some sort of ktv/restaurant hybrid but were still down to give it a shot. the open-room ktv was kind of distracting, so we choice to eat outside but a bunch of them were smoking/talking really loud so it was a lose-lose situation lol. 
we ordered the fresh coconut, a coke, and 2 phos. the coconut was the only thing that went right (but how can you mess that up when you just have to crack it open). the soda was flat, and the noodles that came in the broth were still FROZEN and they made no effort to boil it before putting it in or at least giving it more time before serving it. the broth was tasteless as well and we both left after taking a few bites.

Good food. Friendly staff. The owner is super cool. Full bar with awesome draft beer selection. Reasonably priced. The beef stew is amazing. They do karaoke several times each week if you are into that.  I love this place.

I really have nothing negative to say about Pho Cao.

Their food is consistently good, they're open SUPER late (YAY!) and they have a full bar.  

What really makes me give this place 4 stars, is the owner. He cares SO much about his patrons. I see him walking around the restaurant making sure that everyone is happy.  This place is his baby, and you can tell he's there to nurture it.

Their food is good, the atmosphere is relaxed and fun.

So - Have yourself a beer, a big steaming bowl of Pho, and listen to your friends sing some karaoke (yes, they have karaoke!)

Let me start by saying that we have been here a few times before and their pho is very good. BUT tonight i really wanted pho and we don't get out of work til 9 so i was excited to see when we checked their hours that they were open til 1030. We got there at about 925 and walked in and we're told they were actually closed. I said "aren't you guys open til 1030?" and she responded "oh ya, we are closing up early tonight...."
We drove out of the way to go there and it was just really unprofessional.  If you have a set time that your establishment closes, how can you just decide to shut it down early if you have people coming in seeking service? At least lock the damn door then. Douche...

Every time I have came in I am in the door as soon as they open. Which is 11 am, always pretty much the first or second guest in. I love the atmosphere and will need to come in during happy hour and the night life. 

Ok so the Vegan broth! Yesssss! YESSSS! YESSSS! It is beyond delicious I find myself just waiting til 11 so I can indulge my taste buds in the awesomeness. I'm pretty sure I might be addicted to it. 

The staff is so nice and always on top of everything.  I have now found my new obsession, my new lunch spot. I mean idk about you buy vegan broth just sells it for me.

Moving from the Pho and Starbucks capital of the country to Scottsdale has been tough.( for PHO ) Since Scottsdale thinks Pho Ga is just bland, watery chicken soup they can charge a fortune for, I've been driving to Chandler for the good stuff. THEN this place opened. Yelp reviews have kept me away until today. It's a dark bar atmosphere, Not dirty at all. My server was great. Live music at lunchtime on Sunday was also fun. Now, the pho. Someone complained that the broth was brown not clear.....yea,  well so? It was full of flavor. Clump of noodles in the center, again, yea so ??? they were perfect and lots of them. Happy girl !!!
wonderful, thank you for being here. I'll be back often. Run, don't walk to check this place out, unless you like bowls of water elsewhere, that is.

We were in the area and craving Pho. I found this on Yelp and saw decent reviews. I should have known better the moment we drove up that it wasn't good news.  When we walked in, it was straight up a bar atmosphere with a stage for live music.  It was dark, dingy and I don't know why we didn't just turn around and walk back out, but alas my son was hungry so we stayed and hoped for the best.  There was 1 server and about 3 tables that had patrons.  Our server tried his best, but it was so lackluster.  He never checked on us and we repeatedly had to ask for stuff.  Oh...and what's the point of memorizing what we order when you have to come back 2 times to ask us again what it was we ordered, and then a 3rd and 4th time for us to remind you that you've forgotten to bring us what we ordered.  The pho was terrible.  Three of us ordered it and my husband took a sip of the broth and pushed it aside and couldn't bare to eat any more of it.  My older son ate half because like I said, he was hungry, and my youngest just ate the noodles.  The spring rolls had no meat or shrimp but was completely overstuffed with shredded lettuce.  Ugh. I was so disappointed with this place.  We ended up leaving hungry because we couldn't finish our meals.

This is the place where I first had pho and it was amazing!! Pho Cao is a very friendly and upbeat place! The owner and staff are very helpful and the food is amazing too! I feel that Victor really does strive to make all his guests feel welcome by learning and remembering their names and making them feel so welcomed with every visit. For example when they started serving sushi there was one I did not care for and Victor took it off my bill and brought me something else. 

I am very big on customer service and this place definitely has it. This is my go to pho place and a place to just hang out with friends. Also it's where I recommend other friends to go for pho!

I love coming here and I come here as often as I can and usually pick this place over other Pho places.

Dinner here last night was very nice. We wanted something simple to warm our bellies and fill us up. Two small pho did the trick. One chicken. One vegetables. Lots of sharing. Happy patrons. Lots of sports tvs one with baseball. One football and two basketball. Looked like karaoke coming in later (we were early diners after 600 miles ) .not fancy. Not appealing from the outside. Friendly and nice on the inside. Lets go again. So many choices on the menu

Absolutely love this place at its new location on McDowell Road. I highly suggest to order the A2 on the menu. This is an appetizer that will work for two. It's light and healthy. They have a clean nice atmosphere that comes alive at night with live music ranging from open Mic Night to Tuesday's featuring some highly acclaimed jazz artists. Definitely check this place out!

If you serve a good Veggie Pho you are in my good book. That's the only thing I tried at Pho Cao is their Vegetable Pho with vegan broth and it was just amazing. Add to this a very friendly and attentive service.. a definite 5 star candidate!!

I really like it here.  My partner and I are both vegans and we come here frequently for Pho and sometimes the curry and sometimes the vegan hot pot.  The vegan springrolls are great, and the budda rolls.  The place is cute with good service and fun drinks.  They typically have live music and it is usually nice.  Sometimes the music is too loud to have dinner conversation, so we usually only come if we just feel like chilling and not talking much.
